title: Brian Kennedy - Get On With Your Short Life [Bonus Tracks]
description:
Get On With Your Short Life is sure to appeal to Brian Kennedy&#039;s massive fanbase, as well as win him millions more. Having contributed to several Van Morrison albums and many of his live shows, and having enjoyed three multi-platinum hits in his homeland, Belfast-born Kennedy is already a big star in Ireland. He&#039;s also made inroads into other territories, touring with Tina Turner and the Corrs, and performing in Riverdance on Broadway. And this album--much of it co-written with the stalwart likes of Paul Brady, Boo Hewerdine and Curtis Stigers--is sure to bring more success. Though he occasionally descends into boy-band-ballad clichÃƒÂ© ("Everytime" and "You Take My Breath Away"), Kennedy has put together a collection of relentless good taste. "Call Me Old Fashioned" is sparse and touching: ("Looking In) the Wrong Place", with its snatches of banjo and cleverly timed electronic whine, is beautifully put together by part-time collaborator Calum MacColl; "If You Love Me" shares the cool atmospherics of Sade: "So What If It Rains" approaches the melodic melodrama of Richard Marx, while the title track, softly railing at contemporary obsessions with youth and slimness, recalls 10CC&#039;s classic "I&#039;m Not In Love". Yet Kennedy&#039;s main strength lies in his voice. He never growls or flips like Van, or soars like Tim Buckley, but his vocal is always clear and unfailingly pretty.

- amazon.co.uk
